title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of $$\frac{b}{b-16}$$ and $$\frac{11}{9}$$ is $$9(b-16)$$.
speech: The least common denominator of  fraction, b over, b minus 16,   and  11 ninths  is  9 times, parentheses b minus 16,  .
pacedSpeech: The least common denominator of   fraction, b over, b minus 16,

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$9b=11(b-16)$$.
speech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get  9 b is equal to 11 times, parentheses b minus 16,  .
pacedSpeech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get   9 b is equal to 11 times,  b minus 16,

title: Isolate $$b$$ on One side
text: We can further simplify $$9b=11(b-16)$$ to $$9b=11b-176$$. By subtracting $$11b$$ both sides, we get $$-2b=-176$$. Then we divide by $$-2$$ both sides of the equation and get $$b=88$$ as the final answer.
speech: We can further simplify  9 b is equal to 11 times, parentheses b minus 16,   to  9 b is equal to 11 b minus 176 . By subtracting  11 b  both sides, we get  negative 2 b is equal to, negative 176 . Then we divide by  negative 2  both sides of the equation and get  b is equal to 88  as the final answer.
